intro: Seruneum goyazense, commonly known as the Goyazense seruneum, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to the Brazilian state of Goiás. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. Due to habitat loss and limited research, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
